entry.title: Boeing-backed Wisk Aero reveals a four-seater autonomous air taxi
entry.summary: Air taxi startup Wisk Aero unveiled its sixth-generation aircraft, an all-electric four-seater that can fly without a human pilot. The Boeing-backed company said it will seek approval from the Federal Aviation Administration to carry passengers as part of a commercial air taxi service. Wisk, which was formed in 2019 as a joint venture between Boeing and Kitty Hawk, the flying taxi company bankrolled by Google co-founder Larry Page that recently shut down, is in a race to become the first so-called Advanced Air Mobility company to get the green light from the FAA for passenger testing. Wisk claims that its sixth-generation aircraft is the first electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) candidate for type certification. Under FAA... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Top 5 ways to start off your week for maximum productivity
entry.summary: The key to being productive is having a clear goal and executing on it. But if you're not starting your week off right, then how can you expect to achieve anything? In this blog post we will explore five habits that can help you start off your week for maximum productivity: Water helps increase energy levels, which is a great way to start your day off right! Meditation is a great way to start your day off with a clear mind. It can also be used as an effective form of relaxation, giving you time to think about what you're going to accomplish that day and how it will benefit both yourself and others. Meditation is one of the most simple yet effective ways to improve productivity on any given day because it allows you to focus on one thing at a time without being distracted by other things around you (such as emails or phone calls). Meal prepping is the number one way to ensure that you are eating healthy and getting all of your nutrients. It's a great way to cut corners on food costs, especially when used in conjunction with meal planning. Meal prepping also reduces waste, which not only keeps your wallet happy but also helps reduce pollution as well! Exercise is an excellent way to start your day. It helps you feel energized, motivated and ready for a productive day. If you have a busy schedule, exercise can be done as part of your morning routine or after work; whatever works best for you! Journaling is a great way to reflect on your day and get clarity. It's also an excellent way to start the week off right, because it forces you to be present with yourself and your feelings. I recommend taking a few minutes each day (or more if you have time) after getting up, washing up and making breakfast/lunch/dinner etc., before starting whatever task has been assigned to you for the day in order for it not be forgotten about at all! Start your week off right with these habits. It‚Äôs time to get your productivity on!

entry.title: How we power our open-source neural search with qdrant
entry.summary: This is going to be part of a series of posts in which we show how refinery builds on top of qdrant, an open-source vector search engine. At Kern AI, we believe that the biggest breakthrough in deep learning is all about embeddings. If you wonder what that means: computers can‚Äôt really understand unstructured texts or images. Instead, they require some numeric representation of e.g. a text. But how can you transform text into numbers? This is precisely what neural networks excel at, they can learn such representations. What is the benefit, you might wonder? You can calculate with e.g. the meaning of a text. What is the output of ‚Äúking‚Äù - ‚Äúman‚Äù + ‚Äúwoman‚Äù? With embeddings, you‚Äôll get the numeric representation of ‚Äúqueen‚Äù. And that is nothing less but breakthrough material! In other terms: em‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tim Cook is latest CEO to question the ‚Äòmetaverse‚Äô
entry.summary:
Tim Cook at the recent iPhone 14 launch. | Photo by Kevin Mazur/Getty Images
While Meta funnels billions into CEO Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs pitch for the metaverse, Apple CEO Tim Cook thinks most people couldn‚Äôt even define the metaverse, let alone spend long periods of time living their lives inside of it. ‚ÄúI always think it‚Äôs important that people understand what something is,‚Äù Cook told Dutch publication Bright (via Google Translate). ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôm really not sure the average person can tell you what the metaverse is.‚Äù In other words, despite persistent reports of Apple‚Äôs interest in building all manner of AR and VR hardware, Cook isn‚Äôt ready to claim that the company is working towards any so-called ‚Äúmetaverse.‚Äù Mark Zuckerberg has a different view. Earlier this year, the Meta CEO told his employees that the company is... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: A practical approach to structuring Golang applications
entry.summary: This article will describe the common approaches which are used for structuring Golang applications. Golang does not have an official guideline to structure the project, so it is an opinionated guideline to structure Go applications. Go is an amazing language, it is simply easy to learn and gives you a lot of tooling out of the box. Most of the Gophers who started learning the Golang they have one thing in common, they struggle to figure out how to structure applications due to the lack of official guidelines. The main approach for structuring Golang applications is to start out simple, but with the flexibility to grow. There are no strict rules for the directory structure or how to organize Go project files in a specific way. It is bad because it is easy to create a mess and good because ‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Essential Guide to Create a Kubernetes Cluster Using AWS EKSCLI
entry.summary:
In this tutorial, you'll learn how to set up AWS EKSCLI to create a Kubernetes cluster so that you can focus on your code instead of managing your infrastructure. If you don't have an AWS account, you can use a free Tier account. Create an admin user before creating a Kubernetes cluster. If you have an admin user, you can sign in to the AWS console to set up your cluster. Sign in to the AWS console and go to your IAM dashboard. Click Users ‚Äî> Add User to initialize the addition of users, as shown below.
Then enter your user name in the Username field. K8-demo-Admin is used here. Select the Access Key-Programmatic Access option and click Next: Permissions. Select the Access Key-Programmatic Access option because it is accessible programmatically. As a result, you can use your applica‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
The Folgore EV is one of three GranTurismo models coming. | Image: Maserati
Maserati is releasing new details on its redesigned GranTurismo luxury performance coupe, and offers some fresh tidbits on the upcoming all-electric version of it. Announced in March, The GranTurismo Folgore will be the automaker‚Äôs first EV, and will launch ahead of its Grecale electric crossover SUV announced earlier this year. It‚Äôs all part of the company‚Äôs plan to offer electric versions of every Maserati model by 2025 and shift to EV-only sales by 2030. Today we learn that the GranTurismo Folgore powertrain will be backed by three 300kW permanent magnet electric motors. It‚Äôs built on an 800-volt architecture that enables the car to fast charge at 270kW, similar to the Lucid Air and Porsche Taycan. Maserati is also releasing two... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Electrify your NodeJS AWS Lambdas with Rust
entry.summary:
Introduction
NodeJS runtime for AWS Lambda is one of the most used and for good reasons. It is fast with a short cold start duration, it is easy to develop for it, and it can be used for Lambda@Edge functions. Besides these, JavaScript is one of the most popular languages. Ultimately, it "just makes sense" to use JavaScript for Lambdas. Sometimes, we might find ourselves in a niche situation where would want to be able to squeeze out a little bit more performance from our Lambda. In these cases, we could rewrite our whole function using something like Rust, or we could rewrite only a portion of our code using Rust and call it from a NodeJS host using a mechanism named foreign function interface (FFI). NodeJS provides an API for addons, dynamically-linked shared objects written usually i‚Ä¶

entry.title: Is your old computer 'obsolete', or is it a Linux opportunity?
entry.summary:
Is your old computer 'obsolete', or is it a Linux opportunity? Phil Shapiro Mon, 10/03/2022 - 03:00
You may often hear someone claim a computer, tablet, or smartphone is "obsolete." When you hear such a statement, take a minute to ask yourself, "Is this person speaking an opinion or a fact?" Many times, their statement is an opinion. Let me explain why. When someone declares a computer "obsolete," they often speak from their own point of view. So, if you're a technology professional, a five-year-old computer might indeed be obsolete. But is that same five-year-old computer obsolete to a refugee family fleeing war or famine? Probably not. A computer that is obsolete for you might be a dream computer for someone else. How I refurbish old computers with Linux I have some experie‚Ä¶

entry.title: On a webshop break
entry.summary: We've been building quite a lot of things around the medusa webshop. But I finally hit a point where I must invest more time before writing them. Some things that we still need to look into are: Generic webshop setup (which I won't bore you with) Custom payment provider (mollie) Custom shipment provider (via Post NL) Custom attributes to products Sync with PayPal Zettle Import via CSV Retrieve data from external API about products This is quite the list, and all of them need quite a lot of research from my end before we can do them. If you love this webshop series, subscribe to my newsletter and keep up to date with all the articles I push out. You might be wondering, what can we expect in the meantime then? I have some CSS and JavaScript things that have been added to my backlog, which I'd love to dive into. And like always, if there are specific topics you'd like to know more about: Send me an email or Twitter DM. I'm always happy to adjust articles to what people want to learn. Thank you for reading my blog. Feel free to subscribe to my email newsletter and connect on Facebook or Twitter

Dish and Disney have reached a ‚Äúhandshake deal‚Äù to immediately bring Disney‚Äôs collection of cable networks back to Dish satellite and Sling TV customers. The two companies confirmed the agreement late on Sunday night. ‚ÄúWe are pleased to restore our portfolio of networks on a temporary basis while both parties work to finalize a new deal,‚Äù Disney said in a statement. entry.title: The Pomodorito Technique
entry.summary:
You may have heard about the Pomodoro Technique, a time management method that consists of repeating work and break intervals to help keep focus while getting some needed rest. It is pretty popular in the US among tech employees. The origin of the name is funny: the method's creator used a tomato-shaped kitchen timer to control the work/break blocks (Pomodoro means tomato in Italian). So that is why each work block is called a "Pomodoro." The method is simple. First, you pick a task and then: Work for 25 minutes. Take a 5‚Äì10 minute break. Repeat steps 1‚Äì2 four times. Take a more extended break of 20‚Äì30 minutes. I find this a productive time management method. I follow it often and keep a couple of timers at my desk while I'm working (although they are not tomato-shaped.) Alternatively to the Pomodoro Technique, I introduce you to the tongue-in-cheek Pomodorito Technique (not Lay's affiliated): Eat Doritos for 25 minutes. Work for 5 minutes. Repeat steps 1‚Äì2 four times. Take a more extended break to go to the store and buy more Doritos (you probably ran out at this point). Alternatively, if you have a big stash of Doritos at home, you may use step 4 to take a nap. All that eating is exhausting, and some nice sleep will make digestion easier.
While the Pomodorito Technique is more of a joke, it may be a good burnout index. If you find yourself trying the Pomodoro Technique but quickly spiral into the Pomodorito Technique, it may be about time to take some vacation‚Ä¶ or start looking for a new job! comiCSS.

entry.title: A new Facebook Marketplace rule could make it harder to find legit car listings
entry.summary:
Nick Barclay / The Verge
As if buying a used car isn‚Äôt hard enough, the misleading dealership listings that clutter up selling platforms like Facebook Marketplace and OfferUp don‚Äôt make things any easier. In an update first spotted by a user on Reddit, Meta announced that it‚Äôs limiting dealerships‚Äô ability to list cars on Marketplace, but this likely doesn‚Äôt mean those pesky listings will disappear for good (via Jalopnik). If you‚Äôve ever shopped for a used car online, you probably know the kinds of dealership listings I‚Äôm talking about. They often show only a car‚Äôs required down payment, or ‚Äî even more annoyingly ‚Äî list vehicles at $1 in an attempt to grab your attention. But starting January 30th, 2023, dealerships will run into a roadblock when trying to post... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tesla delivered a record 343,830 vehicles during the third quarter of 2022
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Tesla delivered a record 343,830 vehicles in the third quarter of 2022, a sign that the Elon Musk-owned company has bounced back from a slower second quarter related to COVID-related factory shutdowns. In a report on the automaker‚Äôs site, Tesla says the Model S and X made up 18,672 of its quarterly deliveries, while the Model 3 and Y accounted for 325,158. Tesla made a total of 365,923 cars during the quarter, leaving about 20,000 cars in its inventory. The automaker clarifies that some of these electric vehicles (EVs) were ‚Äúin transit at the end of the quarter,‚Äù adding that they ‚Äúhave been ordered and will be delivered to customers upon arrival at their destination.‚Äù Tesla also notes that it had been difficult to ‚Äúsecure vehicle... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Coinbase paused transactions in US for hours to address bank transfer issues
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Coinbase temporarily stopped transactions for users in the US due to an issue preventing the company from processing withdrawals or deposits involving bank accounts. Problems started around 7AM ET, but the company didn‚Äôt resolve the issue until around 12:40PM ET. ‚ÄúWe are currently unable to take payments or make withdrawals involving US bank accounts. Our team is aware of this issue and is working on getting everything back to normal as soon as possible,‚Äù Coinbase explained on its status page, adding that users could still use a debit card or PayPal account to buy crypto. We're currently experiencing technical issues creating ACH transfers. Rest assured, your funds are safe. Our team will provide an update here and on our Status Page... Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sktch.io - V2 ‚Äî Create no-code functional and data driven platforms
entry.summary:
Sktch.io, the most flexible NoCode Website & Web-App builder there is! Today, we're launching the V2 of Sktch.io a major refactor of the platform that includes many milestones including the possibility to export your projects as standalone NodeJS + ReactJS projects that you can host on our own computer or servers if you want.
This solves the problem of many still reluctant to join the NoCode movement fearing being platform-stuck.
Building your next project is now easier than ever. To help you understand the benefits of using Sktch.io, I'm going to answer three questions:
What makes Sktch.io different from SquareSpace? What makes Sktch.io different from Webflow? What makes Sktch.io different from Bubble? What can you actually do with Sktch.io PomoPlanner.app : A pomodoro-based planner built entirely in NoCode! - rDrop.link : A P2P file transfer service built with Sktch.io - Minimalist-Portfolio : A Portfolio website built in under 1 hour
Sktch.io is just starting out and feedback is what guides our design decisions, so we always welcome any suggestions or questions.
Excited to hear from the community, Yassine ‚Äù

entry.title: Shegby ‚Äî A DAO of locals worldwide who earn by helping travelers
entry.summary:
https://discord.gg/8XPMj7hTxX Step 2. Use our website to subscribe to our App and get your Early adopter role and a special rates for Locals' services - https://shegby.com/
We're building a DAO of Locals who have exceptional knowledge, skills and experience to help Travelers and earn money. Our purpose is to give millions of jobs worldwide for those who'll follow our Help2Earn concept!
Our business models are: 1) P2P-marketplace (we have 1% commission as a Guarantor in transactions between Travelers and Locals); 2) Subscription (Customers doesn't need to talk with Locals, we'll solve any of their issues in 24/7 mode); 3) B2B-sales (we offer a business listing and advertisement for travel/hospitality related companies).
We are at a very early stage now, building a DAO of Locals for reaso‚Ä¶

entry.title: Continuum ‚Äî Get paid in crypto & NFTs for learning courses from experts
entry.summary:
It‚Äôs very likely you are familiar with many of them.
1. Not everyone knows what they want to do for a living. 2. Education is expensive. 3. It can be hard to make a living while studying.
Our beliefs, in response to these problems, are:
1. Education should begin with discovery, especially with so many new fields and facets of work, technologies, and tools coming out every day. 2. Education is a fundamental human right. It should be free. And companies which profit from an educated workforce, are the logical party to carry the cost. 3. A form of UBI (universal basic income)
Continuum has taken a substantial first step in manifesting this vision through the web and mobile launch of our learn-to-earn platform.
Our platform is FREE for learners and content creators. Better than that, we actually reward learners with crypto and proof of completion NFTs for finishing courses and engaging in discussions. The purpose is to create a self-sustaining ecosystem of educators, learners, and mentors at all stages of their journey. The only money coming into the system is from brands looking to build awareness of their technologies and related products, in an organic, laid-back way.
If you vibe with our vision and think it could help you or someone you know, please show us some love, ask questions and visit our site at continuum.xyz to download our app today!‚úåÔ∏è ‚Äù
Discussion | Link

entry.title: What's new with Awk?
entry.summary:
What's new with Awk? Jim Hall Sat, 10/01/2022 - 03:00
Awk is a powerful scripting tool that makes it easy to process text. Awk scripts use a pattern-action syntax, where Awk performs an action for every line in a file that matches a pattern. This provides a flexible yet powerful scripting language to deal with text. For example, the one-line Awk script /error/ {print $1, $2, $3} will print the first three space-delimited fields for any line that contains the word error. While we also have the GNU variant of Awk, called Gawk, the original Awk remains under development. Recently, Brian Kernighan started a project to add Unicode support to Awk. I met with Brian to ask about the origins of Awk and his recent development work on Awk. Jim Hall: Awk is a great tool to parse and proc‚Ä¶

entry.title: How I dock my Linux laptop
entry.summary:
How I dock my Linux laptop Don Watkins Fri, 09/30/2022 - 03:00
Not that long ago, docking a laptop was a new idea to me. Since then, I've set up two different laptops for docking, and I've been more than satisfied with how this configuration works. This article describes how I set up the laptop docking stations and gives tips and guidance for anyone considering the same. How I discovered docking I began 2020 with one laptop: a Darter Pro purchased from System76 the year before. It had been more than adequate, and I enjoyed the freedom of movement that toting a laptop gave me. Then, of course, everything changed. Suddenly, I was at home all the time. entry.title: How Podman packaging works on Linux
entry.summary:
How Podman packaging works on Linux Lokesh Mandvekar Thu, 09/29/2022 - 03:00
Over the past few months, the Podman project has been reworking its process for generating Debian and Ubuntu packages. This article outlines the past and present of the Debian packaging work done by the Podman project team. Please note that this article does not refer to the¬†official Debian and Ubuntu packages that Reinhard Tartler and team created and maintain. Debian build process Long story short, the typical Debian build process involves "Debianizing" an upstream repository. First, a debian subdirectory containing packaging metadata and any necessary patches is added to the upstream repo. Then the dpkg-buildpackage command is run to generate the .deb packages. Older Debian build process for Podma‚Ä¶

entry.title: Build an open source project using this essential advice
entry.summary:
Build an open source project using this essential advice Bolaji Ayodeji Wed, 09/28/2022 - 03:00
Open source is a flourishing and beneficial ecosystem that publicly solves problems in communities and industries using software developed through a decentralized model and community contributions. Over the years, this ecosystem has grown in number and strength among hobbyists and professionals alike. It's mainstream now‚Äîeven proprietary companies use open source to build software. With the ecosystem booming, many developers want to get in and build new open source projects. The question is: How do you achieve that successfully? This article will demystify the lifecycle and structure of open source projects. I want to give you an overview of what goes on inside an open source proje‚Ä¶

entry.title: 6-Figure Websites ‚Äî Helping web designers & developers build businesses
entry.summary:
@itsmatt_g is my handle on there)...
I decided to build 6-Figure Websites.
6FW is the compendium for anyone looking to build a freelancing operation or agency selling websites.
It covers everything from: enriching the design skills businesses are looking for --> to building an offer that businesses will be happy to pay upwards of $5k for.
Along with the 6-Figure Websites Discord Support Group...
You'll be surrounded by others on the same path as you, who you can bounce ideas off of, learn from, and get 24/7 feedback on your designs, sales calls, offers, and more.
We're going against the grain of "build it and they will come" - "make accounts on several freelancing platforms"
I'm teaching designers and developers how to
1. Get clients on THEIR OWN TERMS 2. Work with WHO THEY WANT 3. Build business systems that allow them to scale 4. Automate processes so they don't have to hire
And so much more.
Read more at https://6figuresites.com/
I also have a completely free resource for those of you who want to learn the discipline of web design & development. You can find it at https://mathewg.gumroad.com/l/ze.... ‚Äù
Discussion | Link

entry.title: 165+ JavaScript terms you need to know
entry.summary:
165+ JavaScript terms you need to know Sachin Samal Tue, 09/27/2022 - 03:00
JavaScript is a rich language, with sometimes a seemingly overwhelming number of libraries and frameworks. With so many options available, it's sometimes useful to just look at the language itself and keep in mind its core components. This glossary covers the core JavaScript language, syntax, and functions. JavaScript variables var: The most used variable. Can be reassigned but only accessed within a function, meaning function scope. Variables defined with var move to the top when code is executed. const: Cannot be reassigned and not accessible before they appear within the code, meaning block scope. let: Similar to const with block scope, however, the let variable can be reassigned but not re-declare‚Ä¶

entry.title: Get change alerts from any website with this open source tool
entry.summary:
Get change alerts from any website with this open source tool Leigh Morresi Tue, 09/27/2022 - 03:00
The year was 2020, and news about COVID-19 came flooding in so quickly that everyone felt completely overwhelmed with similar news articles providing updates with varying degrees of accuracy. But all I needed to know was when my official government guidelines changed. In the end, that's all that mattered to me. Whether the concern is a pandemic or just the latest tech news, keeping ahead of changes in website content can be critical. The changedetection.io project provides a simple yet highly capable, open source solution for website change detection and notification. It's easy to set up, and it can notify over 70 (and counting) different notification systems, such as Matrix, M‚Ä¶

entry.title: OpenSSF: on a mission to improve security of open source software
entry.summary:
OpenSSF: on a mission to improve security of open source software Gaurav Kamathe Mon, 09/26/2022 - 03:00
Open source software (OSS), once a niche segment of the development landscape, is now ubiquitous. This growth is fantastic for the open source community. However, as the usage of OSS increases, so do concerns about security. Especially in mission-critical applications‚Äî think medical devices, automobiles, space flight, and nuclear facilities‚Äîsecuring open source technology is of the utmost priority. No individual entity, whether developers, organizations, or governments, can single-handedly solve this problem. The best outcome is possible when all of them come together to collaborate. The Open Source Security Foundation (OpenSSF) formed to facilitate this collaboration. Ope‚Ä¶

entry.title: The story behind Joplin, the open source note-taking app
entry.summary:
The story behind Joplin, the open source note-taking app Richard Chambers Mon, 09/26/2022 - 03:00
In this interview, I met up with Laurent Cozic, creator of the note-taking app, Joplin. Joplin was a winner of the 20i rewards, so I wanted to find out what makes it such a success, and how he achieved it. Could you summarize what Joplin does? Joplin is an open source note-taking app. It allows you to capture your thoughts and securely access them from any device. Obviously, there are other note-taking apps out there‚Äîbut apart from it being free to use, what makes it different? The fact that it is open source is an important aspect for many of our users, because it means there is no vendor locking on the data, and that data can be easily exported and accessed in various ways. entry.title: Drop your database for PostgreSQL
entry.summary:
Drop your database for PostgreSQL Seth Kenlon Sat, 09/24/2022 - 03:00
Databases are tools to store information in an organized but flexible way. A spreadsheet is essentially a database, but the constraints of a graphical application render most spreadsheet applications useless to programmers. With Edge and IoT devices becoming significant target platforms, developers need powerful but lightweight solutions for storing, processing, and querying large amounts of data. One of my favourite combinations is the PostgreSQL database and Lua bindings, but the possibilities are endless. Whatever language you use, Postgres is a great choice for a database, but you need to know some basics before adopting it. Install Postgres To install PostgreSQL on Linux, use your software repository. ‚Ä¶
